intro: Silene scepusiensis, commonly known as the Scepusian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pinkish-purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Silene scepusiensis has small, hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
